thread.title: The World’s Most Beautiful Light Switches, by Way of France – Remodelista Web Story
thread.title_full: The World’s Most Beautiful Light Switches, by Way of France – Remodelista Web Story

author: Remodelista Team
title: The World’s Most Beautiful Light Switches, by Way of France – Remodelista Web Story
text:
The World's Most Beautiful Light Switches, by Way of France - Remodelista
French company Meljac was founded by Andre Bousquet, an engineer by trade who noticed that electrical equipment was lacking in the aesthetics department. A line of sockets, switches, and other fittings featuring refined finishes and quality craftsmanship.
Meljac hardware is available to the trade in the US through LVL.
Meljac’s designs are inspired by industrial 1930s France; notice the drop-shaped toggle switch.
Meljac hardware is made in France of high-quality brass. Contact LVL for pricing and ordering information.
The Eclipse Collection Plate 1 Two-Way Switch, shown in rifle gun slate.
Above L: The Oval 1 Two-Way Switch in brushed nickel.
Meljac offers a range of controls for lighting as well as temperature and sound. Here, the simple Plate 1 Dimmer Switch (a European model).
Reminiscent of nautical hardware, the Round Plate 1 Ground Socket has a water-resistant cover.
The Plate 1 Socket with Cover is made of thick brass.
Meljac’s first products were switches and sockets, but its range soon expanded to other tools such as thermostats and doorbells.
Not upgrading your electrical system anytime soon?
Read more
